results.title: Amazing platypus [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: John Morris, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Shaw
results.brief_description: The playtpus is one of nature’s shy creatures. Only twice has a playtpus bred in captivity. Because they are found only in Australia, and will not breed in zoos, most people know very little about the playtpus. This exceptional film shows the playtpus on dry land, underwater and by means of a carefully sectioned burrow , we even follow him into his home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Morris, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Shaw

results.title: Amazing platypus
results.creator_credit: John Morris, Film Australia, John Shaw and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The platypus is one of nature’s shy creatures. Only twice has a platypus bred in captivity. Because they are found only in Australia, and will not breed in zoos, most people know very little about the platypus. This exceptional film shows the platypus on dry land, underwater and, by means of carefully sectioned burrow, we even follow him into his home. This is a unique chance to see the mammal in its natural environment. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Amazing H2o
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Waterworks”.
‘Episode 2: amazing H2O’ starts with the story of Henry Cavendish (Mark Allen), a rich scientist in the 17th century who made it his mission in life to discover the properties of water. His persistence gave us the H2O chemical name. With 70% of the earth covered in water, it is surprising to learn that scientists know more about the qualities of ice than water itself. Exploring both the realm of the known and unknown, this episode covers the following topics; surface tension, anti-gravitational behaviour, solutions, emulsions, ice, gas, evaporation, crystals. Presented by series producer Dick Beilby.

results.title: Amazing ants
results.brief_description: Explores life in an ant colony. Shows ants fending for and protecting themselves and milking a herd of aphids. Also reveals the intricate tunnels of an underground nest, food storage and the care of young larvae and pupae.

results.title: Amav
results.brief_description: A young child, captivated by a fallen cherry tree blossom, discovers that it also has magic powers. 2-d non-narrated animated Japanese tale. Music by Medwyn Goodall, Qi Zhang.

results.title: Amateur boxing: how to conduct a bout
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, J. Arthur Rank Organisation and Colin Bell
results.brief_description: This film is directed to teachers and instructors rather than boy boxers. It shows a three-round bout between two boys considering the match from the viewpoint of the officials. Demonstrates the work of the referee, the timekeeper and in greater detail, methods used by the referee for controlling the bout, and the methods of the judges for assessing the merits of the boxers. Shows, also, the value of a boxer’s seconds. Demonstrates how boxing can encourage sportsmanship.

results.title: Amarcord
results.creator_credit: Franco Cristaldi, F C Produzioni, PECF and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: Amarcord is Federico Fellini’s visually stunning memoir about being a boy and an adolescent in rural Italy during the rise of Fascism. Set in the mythical coastal town of Rimini, “Amarcord” is not as much a narrative as a series of vignettes tracing Italian history from the rise of Mussolini (1923) to the collapse of the fascist Black Shirts in 1943. But politics in “Amarcord” is always entwined with the lusts, fantasies and desires of Fellini’s teenage alter-ego. By satirising fascism as a burlesque, Fellini creates some of his most ravishing set-pieces, scenes of colour, magic and movement which encompass the many facets of human expression: spiritual, sexual, familial and political. The anchoring of the satire to the memoir of his early life, including his love and obsession with women and their bodies, makes this one of the director’s most accessible and joyful works. It might sound paradoxical that a film dealing with the bleak atrocitities of fascism can command the words “warmth” and “joy” but it is part of Fellini’s purpose in this film to acknowledge the full range of Italian history, and to juxtapose the horrors of the Mussolini period with the perennial cycles of birth, sex, work and death in rural Italy: “Armacord” reminds us that dictators pass but sexuality, family and love are constants. The music score by Nino Rota is one of his finest compositions. The rich colour cinematography is by Giuseppe Rotunno. The DVD edition of “Amarcord” is a carefully digitally restored print and the DVD features a demonstration of the digital restoration of the original damaged negative. The film won the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film in 1974.

results.title: Amanda Gore: brain sex - how to sell to women
results.creator_credit: A G Lifestyle and Dick Collingridge Productions
results.brief_description: Amanda Gore has some stimulating ideas, specific skills and ways of thinking that will guide you into more productive and effective relationship building. Her background is in physiotherapy, psychology and neurolinguistic programming - and her forte is imparting to her audience, the techniques and ways of thinking necessary to change behaviour. She is a professional speaker and conference facilitator and has her own company which offers consulting services in change facilitation, communication excellence, ergonomics and stress ‘busting’. This video was taped at one of Amanda Gore’s lectures and the information within can help you build better relationships. Creating and communication in relationships - at home and at work impacts on performance and productivity. Building better relationships is a way to ‘change the game’ in business and give you the edge over your competitors. Amanda’s latest research will help men and women appreciate the almost totally different ways in which we think, communicate and interact.

results.title: Am I Normal? (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Am I Normal? is a humorous situation comedy about the experiences boys go through during puberty. It presents facts about male sexual development while simultaneously raising important issues about masculinity, identity and peer pressure.

results.title: Am I normal?
results.creator_credit: Debra Franco, New Day Films and David Shepard
results.brief_description: A lighthearted film about male puberty. A young teenager finds answers to his questions about bodily changes such as erection, wet dreams and masturbation. Also deals with related issues such as peer group pressure, self-image, and concepts of masculinity. Includes animated sequences. A companion to Dear Diary. TEACHER PREVIEW RECOMMENDED
